data.name: EXplosive_Number_(Special_Numbers_Series _#8)
data.description: If You Complete the ```Special Numbers Series ```, You Know By Now How To Manipulate (Monkey With) Numbers Effectively , If Not You Can Take a Look To Get How Things Work : Balanced Number STRNOGN - Strong Number Disarium Number Jumping Number Special Number Well , It's Time To Expand Our Series For More : Given a positive integer N , ``` The Task is Determine Whether the Number is "Explosive" Or Not . ``` ``` A Number is "EXplosive" if The Sum of Its Divisors is Greater or Equal to it . ``` ``` Notes : 1- Only Positive Integers Will Passed . 2- The Divisors Vector Contain all Divisors But not the number itself . 3- The Returning Value Will be A Boolean (True or False ) . If Any Of The Previous Points (Notes) Is Not Clear , Pay Attention To The Examples Clarify Everything . ``` ```cpp 1- explosive (6) return (true) Explanation : Divisors are {1,2,3} , Notice that (6) is not considered , since , The sum of divisors is (6) (Greater or Equall to The Number ), then (true). 2- explosive (27) return (false) Explanation : Divisors are {1,3,9} , Notice that (27) is not considered , Since , The sum of divisors is (13) (Less Than The Number ), then (false). 3- explosive (24) return (true) Explanation : Divisors are {1,2,3,4,6,8,12} , Notice that (24) is not considered , Since , The sum of divisors is (36) Greater or Equall to The Number ), then (true). ``` If you feel Enjoyed this Kata , Then How About (Monkey With) Arrays in this Series :: Minimize_Sum_Of_array Maximize_Product_Of_Array Array Leaders Hope you enjoy it .. Awaiting for crafting best Practice and Clever Codes .. ``` ALL Translation are Welcomed (In Any Language )``` Enjoy Learning !!! ``` Zizou ```
